snippet: The cards, blue on the front with an ad for the Gap, confused some riders, but the Metropolitan Transportation Authority expects an increase in revenue.
abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority Metrocards featuring advertisements on both sides go on sale as part of an initiative to increase revenue; ads have appeared on the back of the MetroCard since 1995, but now advertisers can use the entire card, and clothing retailer The Gap is the first to buy space on the card's front.
lead_paragraph: The cards, blue on the front with an ad for the Gap, confused some riders, but the Metropolitan Transportation Authority expects an increase in revenue.

headline.seo: MetroCards Go on Sale with Ads for Gap on Both Sides
headline.main: MetroCards Go on Sale With Ads on Both Sides
headline.print_headline: MetroCards Go on Sale With Ads on Both Sides
